intro: Cryptocarya scortechinii, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a member of the Lauraceae family. It is a tall, tree-like fern that can reach heights of up to 15 meters. The plant has a thick, fibrous trunk and large, pinnately compound leaves that are often used in traditional Māori medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is native to New Zealand. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it an important species in the region's flora.
